msContents.summary: official document, mentioning Kometes John, the church (?) of holy Victor, Apa Kyriakos, and other names such as Mariam, Phaustos and Paulos; dated. A different text in the back in Coptic that mentions the brother Loukas

msItemStruct.note: 14 lines in Greek on the front written in darker ink, 5 lines in Coptic on the back that are partially faded toward the end

on the front the hand is proficient and elaborate; the last two and a half lines of the front are written by a second, faster hand; the back is written upside down with respect ot the front by a third hand
msItemStruct.textLang: front in Greek, back in Coptic

provenance.p: provenance unknown. Owned by Lord Amherst of Hackney when Crum published his edition in 1902. Probably sold at Sotheby in New York in 1921. Purchased by the Metropolitan Museum, MMA inv. 21.2.127. Sold to Columbia University in 1958

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

langUsage.language: front in Greek, back in Coptic

listBibl.bibl: O.Crum 395 published by Crum in O.Crum no 395 (Amherst 2)
